page.title: 02THE LANDSCAPE OF PARR.
page.content: The landscape, until recently has been badly scarred by the Industrial Revolution of the 19th century. In recent years spoil heaps from the coal and chemical industries have been removed, for use as hardcore on local motorways, while the vacated sites have been redeveloped, mainly for new industrial units or landscapd to please the eye. Britain's first industrial canal, which cuts across the area, was built by a local man Henry Berry, who gives his name to Berry's Lane. It has been in disuse since the turn of the century, left derelict until recent efforts to create a Linear Park along its banks, attracting wild life to a barren area and providing a whole new leisure scene for local people.
